name: LATA
short_description: LATA (Local Area Telemetry Architecture) is a concept that incorporates a network protocol, software tool set, and hardware design for a distributed control system.  The primary concept is a logical circuit.  Physical components within a system are wired together and then logically configured to form circuits.  Each logical circuit acts as would any basic electrical circuit.  A switch closes and a message is delivered to the network.  All members of the circuit receive the message and process as needed.  This process may then result in a physical action (e.g. relay closure) or further network messages (e.g. groups).  Further details are covered in the Protocol Specification.  The system is fully expandable and provides scope to build a flexible, user friendly control system.
summary: Distrubuted building control system based on logical circuits.
